featured.text: The new manager is a real gentleman.
She works as a manager in the author’s company.
A railway manager, Knight specialized in designing the signaling system for Britain’s growing railway network in the 1860s.
Yellow is used for general laborers and contractors, white (or sometimes black) for supervisors and managers, and green for inspectors and new workers.

other.text: The manager must try to find out who is really ________ for this serious sales problem.
The manager ______ without hesitation after he had been offered a better job in another company.
He is kind and humble, totally different from the former manager, who was _____ and bossy.
The manager of the company was sued for ______ abusing his colleagues, calling them “hopeless losers.” (A) verbally (B) dominantly (C) legitimately (D)

definition.zh_def: 經理；管理者，負責組織和指導某項工作的個人。
definition.en_def: A person responsible for controlling or administering an organization or group.
definition.example: The manager held a meeting to discuss the new project.
